Tasks.Task Description: Create an Azure Storage account to store blobs. This is the foundational step for using Azure Blob Storage.
Configure the Blob Storage settings, including access tiers, replication, and networking options.
Set up access control using Azure RBAC roles or shared access signatures (SAS) to manage permissions for accessing blobs.
Upload blobs to the storage account using tools like Azure Portal, Azure CLI, or client libraries for various programming languages.
Configure lifecycle management policies to automatically transition blobs to different access tiers or delete them based on specified rules.
Enable logging and monitoring to track access and usage of blobs, and to set up alerts for specific events.
Choose and implement data redundancy options such as LRS, ZRS, GRS, or RA-GRS to ensure data durability and availability.
Configure data encryption at rest and in transit to secure the data stored in Blob Storage.
Integrate Blob Storage with other Azure services like Azure Functions, Azure Logic Apps, and Azure Event Grid for automated workflows.
Use the Azure pricing calculator to estimate costs and set up cost management features to monitor and optimize spending.

Tasks.Task: Set up backup and disaster recovery
Tasks.Task Description: Implement backup and disaster recovery strategies to ensure data protection and business continuity.
Set up network security features like virtual network service endpoints and private endpoints to secure access to Blob Storage.
Set up Blob Storage events to trigger actions in response to blob creation, deletion, or other changes.
Use tools like AzCopy, Azure Data Factory, or third-party solutions to migrate data to Blob Storage.
Enable auditing to track and log access to blobs for compliance and security purposes.
Set up CORS rules to allow web applications from different domains to access Blob Storage resources.
Enable blob versioning to automatically maintain previous versions of blobs and recover from accidental deletions or overwrites.
Enable soft delete for blobs to recover deleted data within a specified retention period.
Configure immutability policies to protect blobs from being modified or deleted for a specified period.
Install and configure BlobFuse to mount Blob Storage containers as file systems on Linux.
